intro: Cyathea urdanetensis, commonly known as the UrdaNet fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk covered in a dense mass of roots. The plant has large, pinnately compound leaves that can reach several meters in length, contributing to its striking appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
